title: EAMENA
text:
Aims

DocumentingTrainingLeveraging






Rapidly assess the status of the archaeological landscape (built heritage)
Provide access to a set of data on endangered heritage (Open Access)




 


Temple of Bel, Palmyra, Syria, year 2014 (left) and 2016 (right) © Google Earth











Database training, in Amman (Jordan), December 2021






Field assessment training, World Heritage Site of Um er-Rasas (Jordan)











Jordan Antiquities Database Information System (JADIS) information system, 1990-95






Middle East Geodatabase for Antiquities Jordan (MEGA Jordan), 2011-…






Jordan Masdar (Arches v5), 2021-…

title: EAMENA
text:
Database

ArchesOpen AccessACHP projectsSemantic Web 


, open source semantic graph geoweb-based information platform for Cultural Heritage management developed by the Getty Conservation Institute (GCI) and the World Monument Fund (WMF) that natively integrates:

CRMbase (CIDOC-CRM)1
Dublin Core Metadata Initiative (DCMI)2
Simple Knowledge Organisation System (SKOS)3
Extended Date/Time Format (EDTF)4
World Geodetic System 1984 (WGS84)5







Batist, Z.; Roe, J., 2024. Open archaeology, open source? Internet Archaeology 67. 10.11141/ia.67.13  Adapted from openarchaeo-collaboration. Graph of open archaeological GitHub repositories and connected users via contributions. Darker edges indicate a higher number of contributions. The color of the nodes indicates membership in the largest groups according to the method of edge betweenness without isolated nodes.

title: EAMENA
text:

WarAgricultureConstructionNaturalLooting








Destruction of the Temple of Bel by ISIS on August 23, 2015 (Palmyra, Syria)


















Development of ploughed fields and orchards around and within an archaeological site (Udhma, Jordan)


















Road over a section of an exposed church excavation (Ma’in, Jordan) ©APAAME .


















The rising sea waters slowly washed away the Temple of Isis (Sabratha, Libya)
